page.title: 07Farming
page.content: The fields in our D block are mainly arable. The fields vary in size from six to forty acres. The main crops are barley, wheat, oilseed rape and peas. When the corn is harvested it is sent to Swallow's corn merchants in Grantham. Grass is grown for silage for cattle feed. Peas and linseed are used as break crops on light ground, and oilseed rape is used as a break crop on heavy ground. In the grass fields there are mainly cattle which are kept for their meat. The farmers in our D block use modern machinery such as combine harvesters, tractors, bailers, sprayers and fertilizer spreaders. Modern machinery means not many people are employed on the farms. At Breeder Hills Farm (300 acres) there are two full time workers and one student.
